body_html:
Hi,

I have similar error:

[ 80%] Linking CXX shared library libATen.so
[ 80%] Built target ATen
Scanning dependencies of target atest
Scanning dependencies of target basic
[ 82%] Building CXX object src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/atest.cpp.o
[ 82%] Building CXX object src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/basic.cpp.o
[ 83%] Linking CXX executable atest
../libATen.so.1: undefined reference to `convolve_5x5_sse'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/build.make:96: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/atest' failed
make[2]: *** [src/ATen/test/atest] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:247: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 84%] Linking CXX executable basic
../libATen.so.1: undefined reference to `convolve_5x5_sse'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/build.make:96: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/basic' failed
make[2]: *** [src/ATen/test/basic] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:210: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:129: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2

OS: Debian 9
CUDA: Disabled
Cudnn: n/a
Python: 3.5.3
no conda, just using pip

However, I'm able to compile on a different Debian. I checked the compilation and there's a difference:

On working system:

[ 76%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/THVector.c.o
[ 77%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/generic/simd/convolve.c.o
[ 78%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/THNN/init.c.o

On non-working system:

[ 76%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/THVector.c.o
[ 78%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/THNN/init.c.o

So build somehow skips compilation of convolve. I don't know why yet.

body:
Hi,

I have similar error:

```
[ 80%] Linking CXX shared library libATen.so
[ 80%] Built target ATen
Scanning dependencies of target atest
Scanning dependencies of target basic
[ 82%] Building CXX object src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/atest.cpp.o
[ 82%] Building CXX object src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/basic.cpp.o
[ 83%] Linking CXX executable atest
../libATen.so.1: undefined reference to `convolve_5x5_sse'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/build.make:96: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/atest' failed
make[2]: *** [src/ATen/test/atest] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:247: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/atest.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
[ 84%] Linking CXX executable basic
../libATen.so.1: undefined reference to `convolve_5x5_sse'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/build.make:96: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/basic' failed
make[2]: *** [src/ATen/test/basic] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:210: recipe for target 'src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [src/ATen/test/CMakeFiles/basic.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:129: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
```

OS: Debian 9
CUDA: Disabled
Cudnn: n/a
Python: 3.5.3
no conda, just using pip

However, I'm able to compile on a different Debian. I checked the compilation and there's a difference:

On working system:

```
[ 76%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/THVector.c.o
[ 77%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/generic/simd/convolve.c.o
[ 78%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/THNN/init.c.o
```

On non-working system:
```
[ 76%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/TH/THVector.c.o
[ 78%] Building C object src/ATen/CMakeFiles/ATen.dir/__/THNN/init.c.o
```

So build somehow skips compilation of `convolve`. I don't know why yet.
